TopicTitle: who needs fuel lines when you have FAR?

Articles.Content: 36.2 tons to a 100x10 orbit (I like to avoid debris when I can) with a margin of about 50 m/s delta-V. is incredibly tense to fly because it drops to a TWR of 0.6 while the boosters are still running.
That setup really wouldn't need fuel lines anyway. The mainsail is fueled by the center tanks, and the outboard boosters are fed by their attached tanks.

it would just be much more pleasant to fly with fuel lines, but I wanted to see what I could do without them and 2.5 meter boosters. there was a time when getting an orange tank into orbit seemed completely impossible to me.

it would just be much more pleasant to fly with fuel lines, but I wanted to see what I could do without them and 2.5 meter boosters. there was a time when getting an orange tank into orbit seemed completely impossible to me.

I am there again, with the RSS mod. Getting a crew of three into a 400km orbit is a challenge, let alone getting 32 tons into orbit.
